New-York Historical Society
Nancy Sirkis photographs
Sirkis, Nancy
PR 387
2.5 Linear Feet in 1 flat folder
2006-2008 This collection consists of 8 photographs of New York City street scenes, including images from each of the five boroughs: 2 photos each of Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens, and 1 photo each of the Bronx and Staten Island. The photographs, which were taken between 2006 and 2008, are captioned, signed, and dated by the photographer, Nancy Sirkis.
Access Restrictions
Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.
Use Restrictions
Permission to reproduce any Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections holdings through publication must be obtained from: Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 270. Fax: (212) 579-8794. Email: rightsandrepro@nyhistory.org
Preferred Citation
The collection should be cited as: Nancy Sirkis Photographs, PR 387, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Credit line should read: Nancy Sirkis
Arrangement
The photos are arranged chronologically.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Gift of Nancy Sirkis, 2008.
Scope and Contents
This collection consists of 8 color digital prints from an ongoing project by photographer Nancy Sirkis called "Five Boroughs," a study of New York City begun in 2004. It includes 2 photos each of Manhattan, Brooklyn and Queens, and 1 photo each of the Bronx and Staten Island. The photographs were taken between 2006 and 2008, and focus on the streetscape and built environment of particular neighborhoods. The inkjet prints on Hahnemuhle paper measure approximately 17"x30", and are captioned, signed, and dated by the photographer, Nancy Sirkis.
Processing Information
processed by Archivist Marybeth Kavanagh, January 2019
Separated Materials
These photographs were separated from the N-YHS Collection of Geographic Images, PR 20, in 2019.
Biographical / Historical
Nancy Sirkis was born in New York City in 1936. She received her Bachelor of Fine Arts degree from the Rhode Island School of Design and a Master of Arts from Hunter College. Published books of her photographs include "Pleasures and Palaces" (1962), "One Family" (1971), and "Reflections of 1776: The Colonies Revisited" (1974).
